hanzi-su-wiki:
穏

Значения

Тихий, мирный, спокойный

Мнемоника

Займешь работой ту 爫 и другую руку 彐 и на сердце 心 станет спокойно. Возделывать зерновые 禾, заниматься мирным трудом землепашца.

Варианты

稳, 穩
purpleculture_pinyin:
wěn
Japanese variant of 稳
Японский вариант стабильной
rtega_mnemonic:
穩穩RS
穏穏		calm, quiet, peace, moderation
  • work with one's hands 㥯/𢚩 to harvest the grain 禾: calm and peaceful work
heisig_constituent: calm, wheat, cereal, hideaway, claw, vulture, broom, heart
koohiiStory1: The farmer is calm knowing that his wheat fields are protected from vultures by his strawman with a heart (all the better to do the job properly).
koohiiStory2: This whole kanji is a picture of calmness. The wheat has been harvested and even the vultures sit calmly watching the humans sweep and clean-up after the harvest is over. Hearts are peaceful and calm at this time of the year. Even the days are calm without storm.
jp_example_words: 穏やか(おだやか): calm, gentle, quiet
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Some grains get stuck in his cleat, and Wolverine's heart grows calm. Wolverine had been screaming and yelling and stomping around, but when the grains entered his cleat he realized where he was. He was is finally able to calm down.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: He's calm now because he stomped right into a farmer's field (thus the rice) and if he didn't calm down he'd probably ruin it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Now that Wolverine is calm, tears come to his eyes. Being calm has given him perspective on what his anger has done. Oh, wait no. There are just some onions (おん) in his cleats too, and they're making calm tears trickle down his eyes.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Wolverine sitting calmly in this field, onions causing tears to stream down his cheeks as he reflect on what he's done.
Ru_Radicals: ヨ, 心 (сердце), 爪 (ноготь), 禾 (ость колоса)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the grain (禾) claws a yo from your heart (㥯) and makes you calm

Name meaning

wěn
яп. вм. 稳
Radicals: 禾, ヨ, 心  (grain, wolverine, heart, cleat)
Meaning Mnemonic
Some grains get stuck in his cleat, and Wolverine's heart grows calm. Wolverine had been screaming and yelling and stomping around, but when the grains entered his cleat he realized where he was. He was is finally able to calm down.
He's calm now because he stomped right into a farmer's field (thus the rice) and if he didn't calm down he'd probably ruin it.
Reading Mnemonic
Now that Wolverine is calm, tears come to his eyes. Being calm has given him perspective on what his anger has done. Oh, wait no. There are just some onions (おん) in his cleats too, and they're making calm tears trickle down his eyes.
Picture Wolverine sitting calmly in this field, onions causing tears to stream down his cheeks as he reflect on what he's done.
